channel.title: Quotations suggestion
channel.description:
There's an option in the posts and topics section of the admin panel to remove nested quotes. Removes amount of scrolling people have to do to read quote replies and the like. If people want to see the nested quotes, they can just click on the link above the quote to jump to it.
Any support/opposition?

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

No.

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:12, topic:380644”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=476469.msg3484943#msg3484943 date=1296464131]

this

[size=30pt]versus[/size]

[quote author=Newty link=topic=476469.msg3484900#msg3484900 date=1296456267]

I remember having this discussion long ago, someplace…

Either way, that is the default of some forums like vb, but I never like it because you don’t know the full story of what is going on without having to click a million links. People should just be responsible for cutting out the parts of quotes that aren’t relevant, I do this all the time.

Agreed, just leave it the way it is.
[/quote]i see what you did there

see what I’m doing here?

you are irrelevant.

I support this.

this

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I’ve got balls of steel

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yea, the way the SMF option for quote pyramids work is that when you click ‘quote’ it either takes the whole thing or no quote tags. The way a user-set option like that would have to work would be to modify the code that parses bb-code for each user. Also, what would happen if the user clicked the ‘quote’ button, would it include the whole thing and hide it from them? Or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Ollie:

maybe have an option to have pyramid quotes hidden, and available to show on the user panel. Personally I would leave it as is as it is funny to see some trolls, sometimes.

I was thinking that too, but I couldn’t find any mods on simplemachines for it. Oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

maybe have an option to have pyramid quotes hidden, and available to show on the user panel. Personally I would leave it as is as it is funny to see some trolls, sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I prefer how it is now, just get rid of stuff you aren’t responding to in your quotes. And break up quotes into small fragments, and respond to them. Like Niall does!

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Is it really that much of a problem? The odd quote pyramid aside, it’s easier to see precisely what is going on in the conversation (as opposed to having to jump around, as you’ve described).

Read full topic

item.title: Quotations suggestion
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:1, topic:380644”]There’s an option in the posts and topics section of the admin panel to remove nested quotes. Removes amount of scrolling people have to do to read quote replies and the like. If people want to see the nested quotes, they can just click on the link above the quote to jump to it.

Any support/opposition?[/quote]
I think it’d be neater if you could just click on the quotes that were hidden, and they’d unfold within the current quote tags…

Read full topic
